column10: Definition of the variables
time horizon of the project (in years)
Probability that a natural hazard occurs, ex-post risk (between 0 and 1)
Discount rate (used for costs and benefits)
Probability of bad maintenance, relevant only for check dams and buffer strips, ex-post risk (between 0 and 1)
Probability that the intervention is not properly designed, ex-post risk (between 0 and 1)
Probability that farmers do not comply with rules resulting from an intervention, e.g. they cultivate again on the banks of the reservoir (between 0 and 1)
Probability that population do not contribute to the dredging, e.g. no labor supply, ex-ante risk (between 0 and 1)
Probability that donors do not contribute to the dredging, e.g. no funding, ex-ante risk (between 0 and 1)
Probability that population do not contribute to check dams, e.g. no labor supply, ex-ante risk (between 0 and 1)
Probability that institutions do not support check dams, e.g. no enforcement upstream, ex-ante risk (between 0 and 1)
Probability that donors to not contribute to the check dams, e.g. no funding, ex-ante risk (between 0 and 1)
Probability that population do not support buffer strips, e.g. no labor supply, no compliance, ex-ante risk (between 0 and 1)
Probability that institutions do not support buffer strips, e.g. no participation in the implementation, ex-ante risk (between 0 and 1)
Probability that donors to not contribute to buffer strips, e.g. no funding, ex-ante risk (between 0 and 1)
Current irrigation formal irrigation area (in ha)
Total livestock population (TLU) in the current situation (baseline case)
Change in the total livestock population (TLU) if buffer strips are implemented (in percent, with respect to the baseline)
Current profit generated per TU (in dollars)
Desired coefficient of variation in the w function (in percent)
column11: Footnote: The w function produces time series that contain variation from a specified mean and a desired coefficient of variation.
